data: A theatre by daylight, a great historical picture in the process of cleaning, a ballet-dancer of a wet day hastening to rehearsal, the favorite for the Oaks dead-lame in a straw-yard, are scarcely more stripped of their legitimate illusions than is a fashionable watering-place on the approach of winter.

A THEATRE by daylight, a great historical picture in the process of cleaning, a ballet-dancer of a wet day hastening to rehearsal, the favorite for the Oaks dead-lame in a straw-yard, are scarcely more stripped of their legitimate illusions than is a fashionable watering-place on the approach of winter.
The Daltons; Or, Three Roads In Life. Volume I
The Daltons; Or, Three Roads In Life. Volume I (of II)
Lever, Charles James, 1806-1872; Browne, Hablot Knight, 1815-1882 [Illustrator]
